Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api

Interface RhymeBuilder

@ProviderType public interface RhymeBuilder
A fluent builder to configure and create a single Rhyme instance, which then should be used throughout the lifecycle of the current incoming request.

If you are only using Rhyme as a HAL client library (but not to render HAL+JSON responses), you can also use HalApiClient directly.

See Also:
  • Rhyme

  • Method Details

    • withoutResourceLoader

      @Deprecated static RhymeBuilder withoutResourceLoader()
      Deprecated.
      no longer required because there is now a default HalResourceLoader implementation available, use create() instead
      Create a RhymeBuilder that can only build Rhyme instances which do not request any resources from upstream services
      Returns:
      the new instance

    • create

      static RhymeBuilder create()
      Create a RhymeBuilder to build Rhyme instances that use a simple default HTTP client to load upstream resources. If you need to customize your HTTP request handling (e.g. authentication or caching), then use withResourceLoader(HalResourceLoader) instead.
      Returns:
      the new instance

    • withResourceLoader

      static RhymeBuilder withResourceLoader(HalResourceLoader resourceLoader)
      Create a RhymeBuilder to build Rhyme instances that use the given HalResourceLoader
      Parameters:
      resourceLoader - used to to load resources from upstream services
      Returns:
      the new instance

    • withRhymeDocsSupport

      RhymeBuilder withRhymeDocsSupport(RhymeDocsSupport rhymeDocsSupport)
      Enable generation of "curies" links (to HTML documentation generated with the rhyme-docs-maven-plugin) when rendering HalResponses with Rhyme.renderResponse(LinkableResource). If you call this method, you also have to ensure that you actually serve the generated HTML files using RhymeDocsSupport.loadGeneratedHtml(RhymeDocsSupport, String)
      Parameters:
      rhymeDocsSupport - the SPI instance that handles loading of the generated HTML
      Returns:
      this

    • withReturnTypeSupport

      RhymeBuilder withReturnTypeSupport(HalApiReturnTypeSupport additionalTypeSupport)
      Extend the core framework to support additional return types in your annotated HAL API interfaces. You can call this method multiple times if you want to register more than one extension.
      Parameters:
      additionalTypeSupport - extension to the default type support
      Returns:
      this

    • withAnnotationTypeSupport

      RhymeBuilder withAnnotationTypeSupport(HalApiAnnotationSupport additionalTypeSupport)
      Extend the core framework to support additional annotation types in your annotated HAL API interfaces. You can call this method multiple times if you want to register more than one extension.
      Parameters:
      additionalTypeSupport - extension to the default type support
      Returns:
      this

    • withExceptionStrategy

      RhymeBuilder withExceptionStrategy(ExceptionStatusAndLoggingStrategy customStrategy)
      Allow the exception handling of the core framework to support additional platform / framework specific exceptions. You can call this method multiple times if you want to register more than one extension.
      Parameters:
      customStrategy - extension to the default exception handling.
      Returns:
      this

    • withMetadataConfiguration

      RhymeBuilder withMetadataConfiguration(RhymeMetadataConfiguration configuration)
      Configures the capturing of extensive performance and upstream response metadata for this request, which can be included as an embedded resource in the response.
      Parameters:
      configuration - to determine whether metadata should be rendered and included in the current request
      Returns:
      this

    • withObjectMapper

      RhymeBuilder withObjectMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper)
      Replace the default Jackson ObjectMapper used for JSON (de)serialization with a customized instance. Note that this object mapper is only used when converting Java to JSON objects (and vice versa). It's not used when the raw JSON response from an upstream service is parsed.
      Parameters:
      objectMapper - a configured ObjectMapper instance (which can be a single shared instance)
      Returns:
      this

    • withRemoteResourceOverride

      <T> RhymeBuilder withRemoteResourceOverride(String entryPointUri, Class<T> halApiInterface, Function<RequestMetricsCollector,T> factoryFunc)
      Defines an override that will make Rhyme.getRemoteResource(String, Class) return a custom implementation for a specific combination of entry point URI and interface class (rather then the default dynamic proxy). This can be used to mock/stub remote resources in unit and integration tests, or to delegate remote resource proxy creation for a specific service to a completely different Rhyme or HalApiClient instance.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the HalApiInterface type
      Parameters:
      entryPointUri - the URI for which the override will be used
      halApiInterface - an interface defining the HAL API for that URI
      factoryFunc - a function that will create a proxy, stub or server-side implementation of the given interface
      Returns:
      this

    • buildForRequestTo

      Rhyme buildForRequestTo(String incomingRequestUri)
      Create the Rhyme instance to be used to throughout the lifecycle of an incoming request
      Parameters:
      incomingRequestUri - URI of the incoming request (can be absolute or relative, depending on the platform/framework)
      Returns:
      the new instance
